COMMON.ERROR_TOO_MANY_OBJECTS: Too many objects match the criterias.

HELP.ROTATE: Left mouse click and drag for rotation around the target
HELP.TRANSLATE: Right mouse click and drag for translation of the target
HELP.ZOOM: Mouse wheel for zooming/dezooming from target
HELP.GOTO: Left mouse single click on an object to navigate

TOOLTIP.HYGMAP: See this star on HYGMap website
TOOLTIP.TITLE: Star properties

HYG.RA: The star's right ascension, for epoch and equinox 2000.0
HYG.DEC: The star's declination ascension, for epoch and equinox 2000.0
HYG.HIP: The star's ID in the Hipparcos catalog, if known.
HYG.HD: The star's ID in the Henry Draper catalog, if known.
HYG.HR: The star's ID in the Harvard Revised catalog, which is the same as its number in the Yale Bright Star Catalog.
HYG.GL: The star's ID in the third edition of the Gliese Catalog of Nearby Stars.
HYG.BF: The Bayer / Flamsteed designation, primarily from the Fifth Edition of the Yale Bright Star Catalog.
HYG.PROPER: A common name for the star.
HYG.PMRA: The star's proper motion in right ascension, in milliarcseconds per year.
HYG.PMDEC: The star's proper motion in declination, in milliarcseconds per year.
HYG.RV: The star's radial velocity in km/sec, where known.
HYG.ABSMAG: The star's absolute visual magnitude (its apparent magnitude from a distance of 10 parsecs).
HYG.SPECT: The star's spectral type, if known.
HYG.CI: The star's color index (blue magnitude - visual magnitude), where known.
HYG.X: The X Cartesian coordinate of the star in parsecs, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth.
HYG.Y: The Y Cartesian coordinate of the star in parsecs, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth.
HYG.Z: The Z Cartesian coordinate of the star in parsecs, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth.
HYG.VX: The Cartesian X velocity component of the star, in parsecs per year.
HYG.VY: The Cartesian Y velocity component of the star, in parsecs per year.
HYG.VZ: The Cartesian Z velocity component of the star, in parsecs per year.
HYG.RARAD: The star's right ascension, in radians.
HYG.PMRARAD: The star's proper motion in right ascension, in radians.
HYG.PMDECRAD: The star's proper motion in declination, in radians.
HYG.BAYER: The Bayer designation as a distinct value.
HYG.FLAM: The Flamsteed number as a distinct value.
HYG.COMP: Identifies a star in a multiple star system (comp = ID of companion star).
HYG.COMP_PRIMARY: Identifies a star in a multiple star system (comp_primary = ID of primary star for this component).
HYG.BASE: Identifies a star in a multiple star system (base = catalog ID or name for this multi-star system).
HYG.LUM: Star's luminosity as a multiple of Solar luminosity.
HYG.VAR: Star's standard variable star designation, when known.
HYG.VAR_MIN: Star's approximate magnitude range (min), for variables.
HYG.VAR_MAX: Star's approximate magnitude range (max), for variables.
HYG.TYC: The star's ID in the Tycho catalog, if known.

KHARCHENKO.RA: The star's right ascension, for epoch and equinox 2000.0
KHARCHENKO.DEC: The star's declination ascension, for epoch and equinox 2000.0
KHARCHENKO.PLX: The star's trigonometric parallax in milliarcseconds.
KHARCHENKO.HIP: The star's ID in the Hipparcos catalog, if known.
KHARCHENKO.HD: The star's ID in the Henry Draper catalog, if known.
KHARCHENKO.DM: The star's DM number, if known.
KHARCHENKO.HR: The star's ID in the Harvard Revised catalog, which is the same as its number in the Yale Bright Star Catalog.
KHARCHENKO.GL: The star's ID in the third edition of the Gliese Catalog of Nearby Stars.
KHARCHENKO.BF: The Bayer / Flamsteed designation, primarily from the Fifth Edition of the Yale Bright Star Catalog.
KHARCHENKO.PROPER: A common name for the star.
KHARCHENKO.PMRA: The star's proper motion in right ascension, in milliarcseconds per year.
KHARCHENKO.PMDEC: The star's proper motion in declination, in milliarcseconds per year.
KHARCHENKO.RV: The star's radial velocity in km/sec, where known.
KHARCHENKO.ABSMAG: The star's absolute visual magnitude (its apparent magnitude from a distance of 10 parsecs).
KHARCHENKO.SPECT: The star's spectral type, if known.
KHARCHENKO.CI: The star's color index (blue magnitude - visual magnitude), where known.
KHARCHENKO.X: The X Cartesian coordinate of the star in parsecs, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth.
KHARCHENKO.Y: The Y Cartesian coordinate of the star in parsecs, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth.
KHARCHENKO.Z: The Z Cartesian coordinate of the star in parsecs, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth.
KHARCHENKO.VX: The Cartesian X velocity component of the star, in parsecs per year.
KHARCHENKO.VY: The Cartesian Y velocity component of the star, in parsecs per year.
KHARCHENKO.VZ: The Cartesian Z velocity component of the star, in parsecs per year.
KHARCHENKO.RARAD: The star's right ascension, in radians.
KHARCHENKO.PMRARAD: The star's proper motion in right ascension, in radians.
KHARCHENKO.PMDECRAD: The star's proper motion in declination, in radians.
KHARCHENKO.BAYER: The Bayer designation as a distinct value.
KHARCHENKO.FLAM: The Flamsteed number as a distinct value.
KHARCHENKO.COMP: Identifies a star in a multiple star system (comp = ID of companion star).
KHARCHENKO.COMP_PRIMARY: Identifies a star in a multiple star system (comp_primary = ID of primary star for this component).
KHARCHENKO.BASE: Identifies a star in a multiple star system (base = catalog ID or name for this multi-star system).
KHARCHENKO.LUM: Star's luminosity as a multiple of Solar luminosity.
KHARCHENKO.VAR: Star's standard variable star designation, when known.
KHARCHENKO.VAR_MIN: Star's approximate magnitude range (min), for variables.
KHARCHENKO.VAR_MAX: Star's approximate magnitude range (max), for variables.
KHARCHENKO.TYC1: Region number of the star's ID in the Tycho catalog, if known.
KHARCHENKO.TYC2: Within region number of the star's ID in the Tycho catalog, if known.
KHARCHENKO.TYC3: Specific number of the star's ID in the Tycho catalog, if known.
